title: Alberto Costa: 'We must do the opposite of what the terrorists seek to achieve' | Leicester Mercury
text:
Comments (0) 
Just over a week ago, our country witnessed a horrific attack at Westminster - an attack which resulted in the loss of innocent civilians and a dedicated police officer, PC Keith Palmer. 
As the Prime Minister said shortly after, the location was not a coincidence â€“ this was an attack on the heart of our democracy. 
While we remember and pay tribute to those who lost their lives, we must continue to do the exact opposite of what terrorists seek to achieve. 
We should continue with our normal everyday lives and maintain our British values. 
Read more: Four months of roadworks loom in revamp of city centre street 
It is right that for this reason, the House of Commons has continued as normal with the course outlined by the Prime Minister, for the triggering of Article 50. 
On June 23, 2016, the public voted by a margin of nearly 1.3 million for us to leave the EU. 
The Prime Minister has rightly rejected calls for a second referendum and attempts for us to stay in the EU by the back door. She has correctly asserted the importance of focusing our time, energy and resource on securing the best deal for the whole of the United Kingdom. 
This means, providing certainty for EU citizens in the UK, and UK citizens in EU nations at the earliest possible opportunity. This is why I raised this directly with the Prime Minister and received her personal reassurance on this matter. 
The Government's 'Plan for Britain' will change the way our country works to ensure it works for everyone. 
A Global Britain that is outward-looking, where success is based on merit, drive and ability; not on privilege. 
Central to achieving this vision, is making sure we maintain the Union of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. 
This is a Union going back over 300 years, which has been an overwhelming success for all of us, here in Leicester and Leicestershire and indeed across the UK. 
Read more: Street cordoned off by police after reported stabbing 
Whilst antagonists from the SNP seek to spread divide and discord, it is important that each of us, continues to fight to protect Great Britain. 
It is OUR country, not that of the separatists. Let us not be fooled. They wish to end Great Britain during Brexit and we must fight to strengthen our country. 
It is now more important than ever, that the country unites behind our Prime Minister as she leads our negotiations with the EU. 
I hope and indeed expect that with her strong leadership and the right Plan for Britain, we will implement the democratic will of the people, get a good deal with our European allies and move forward as a stronger United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
